FuncDef:
The e1 unframed command configures the E1 channel of a CPOS-Trunk interface to work in clear channel mode and creates a 2.048 Mbit/s synchronous serial interface.
The undo e1 unframed command deletes the synchronous serial interface formed by an E1 channel that works in clear channel mode.
By default, no synchronous serial interface is created on the CPOS-Trunk interface.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the E1 channel number of a CPOS interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 63.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure an E1 channel of a CPOS-Trunk interface to work in clear channel mode, run the e1 unframed command. After an E1 channel is configured to work in clear channel mode, the E1 channel neither contains frame control information nor supports timeslots. It can be used only as a trunk serial interface.
Prerequisites
A CPOS-Trunk interface has been created using the interface cpos-trunk trunk-id command.
Precautions
To ensure a device's processing capability, a CPOS-Trunk interface can have a maximum of 256 trunk serial interfaces bundled.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
